info.title: Papr Memory API
info.description:
API for managing personal memory items with authentication and user-specific data.
    
    ## Authentication
    This API supports three authentication methods:
    
    - **API Key**: Include your API key in the `X-API-Key` header
      ```
      X-API-Key: <your-api-key>
      ```
    
    - **Session Token**: Include your session token in the `X-Session-Token` header
      ```
      X-Session-Token: <your-session-token>
      ```
    
    - **Bearer Token**: Include your OAuth2 token from Auth0 in the `Authorization` header
      ```
      Authorization: Bearer <token>
      ```
    
    All endpoints require one of these authentication methods.

post.description:
Add a new memory item to the system with size validation and background processing.
This endpoint allows storing text content with optional metadata and supports background
processing for semantic search optimization.
**Key Features:**
- Add a new memory item to the system
- Validate content size against MAX_CONTENT_LENGTH environment variable (defaults to 15000 bytes)
- Support background processing for semantic search optimization
- Requires valid Authorization header (Bearer token or Session token)
- Requires Content-Type: application/json header
- Requires X-Client-Type header (e.g., 'papr_plugin', 'browser_extension')
**Request Examples:**
1. Basic memory creation:
```
{
    "content": "Memory content text"
}
```
2. Memory with metadata:
```
{
    "content": "Memory content text",
    "type": "note|meeting|task|etc",
    "metadata": {
        "tags": ["tag1", "tag2"],
        "participants": ["user@example.com"],
        "project_id": "proj-123",
        ...
    }
}
```
3. Memory with context and metadata:
```
{
    "content": "Memory content text",
    "type": "note|meeting|task|etc",
    "metadata": {
        "tags": ["tag1", "tag2"],
        "participants": ["user@example.com"],
        "project_id": "proj-123",
        ...
    },
    "context": {
        "source": "email|chat|document",
        "thread_id": "thread-456",
        "related_docs": ["doc-789"]
    }
}
```
**Response Examples:**
200 OK:
```
{
    "code": 200,
    "status": "success",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "memory-id-123",
            "metadata": {
                "tags": ["tag1", "tag2"],
                "participants": ["user@example.com"],
                "project_id": "proj-123",
                ...
            }
        }
    ]
}
```
207 Partial Content:
```
{
    "code": 207,
    "status": "partial success",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "memory-id-123",
            "metadata": {
                "tags": ["tag1", "tag2"],
                "participants": ["user@example.com"],
                "project_id": "proj-123",
                ...
            }
        }
    ]
}
```
400 Bad Request:
```
{
    "code": 400,
    "detail": "Invalid request data"
}
```
401 Unauthorized:
```
{
    "code": 401,
    "detail": "Invalid access token"
}
```
403 Forbidden:
```
{
    "code": 403,
    "detail": "Subscription limit reached"
}
```
413 Payload Too Large:
```
{
    "code": 413,
    "detail": "Content size (15001 bytes) exceeds maximum limit of 15000 bytes"
}
```
415 Unsupported Media Type:
```
{
    "code": 415,
    "detail": "Unsupported Media Type"
}
```
500 Internal Server Error:
```
{
    "code": 500,
    "detail": "Internal server error"
}
```

schema.title: Response Add Memory Add Memory Post

post.description:
Add multiple memory items in a batch.

Args:
    request (Request): FastAPI request object containing array of memory items
    response (Response): FastAPI response object for setting status codes
    background_tasks (BackgroundTasks): FastAPI background tasks handler
    skip_background_processing (bool, optional): Skip background processing if True. Defaults to False.
    batch_size (int, optional): Number of items to process in parallel. Defaults to 10.

Returns:
    Union[BatchMemoryResponse, ErrorDetail]: Either:
        - BatchMemoryResponse containing:
            - successful: List of successfully processed items
            - errors: List of failed items with error details
            - total_processed: Total number of items processed
            - total_successful: Number of successful items
            - total_failed: Number of failed items
            - total_content_size: Total size of content in bytes
            - total_storage_size: Total storage size in bytes
        - ErrorDetail containing:
            - code: HTTP status code (400, 401, etc.)
            - detail: Error message

Raises:
    No exceptions are raised - all errors are returned as ErrorDetail responses

schema.title: Response Add Memory Batch Add Memory Batch Post

post.description:
Add a memory item with tenant/connector/stream details.

Args:
    request (Request): FastAPI request object containing the memory data
    response (Response): FastAPI response object for setting status codes
    tenant_subtenant (str): Combined tenant and subtenant IDs in format 'tenant_subtenant'
    connector (str): The connector type (e.g., 'slack', 'gmail')
    stream (str): The data stream identifier
    background_tasks (BackgroundTasks): FastAPI background tasks handler
    skip_background_processing (bool, optional): Skip background processing if True. Defaults to False.

Returns:
    Union[AddMemoryResponse, ErrorDetail]: Either:
        - AddMemoryResponse containing:
            - code: Status code ('SUCCESS' or other)
            - status: Status message
            - data: List of added memory items
        - ErrorDetail containing:
            - code: HTTP status code (400, 401, etc.)
            - detail: Error message

Raises:
    No exceptions are raised - all errors are returned as ErrorDetail responses

schema.title: Response Add Memory With Details Add Memory  Tenant Subtenant   Connector   Stream  Post

post.description: Add multiple memory items in a batch with tenant details.

schema.title: Response Add Memory Batch With Details Add Memory Batch  Tenant Subtenant   Connector   Stream  Post

post.description:
Retrieve relevant memory items based on query and context.

Args:
    request (Request): FastAPI request object
    response (Response): FastAPI response object
    max_memory_items (int): Maximum number of memory items to return (default: 15, max: 50)
    max_neo_items (int): Maximum number of neo nodes to return (default: 15, max: 50)

Returns:
    Union[GetMemoryResponse, ErrorDetail]: Contains list of relevant memory items or error details

schema.title: Response Get Memory Get Memory Post

delete.description:
Delete a memory item by ID.

Args:
    request (Request): FastAPI request object
    response (Response): FastAPI response object
    id (str): ID of the memory to delete
    skip_parse (bool): Skip Parse Server deletion if True

Returns:
    Union[DeleteMemoryResponse, ErrorDetail]: Either:
        - DeleteMemoryResponse containing:
            - message: Optional success message
            - error: Optional error message
            - memoryId: ID of the deleted memory
            - objectId: Parse Server object ID
            - status: DeletionStatus for each system
            - code: Status code string
        - ErrorDetail containing:
            - code: HTTP status code
            - detail: Error message

parameters.name: id

schema.description: ID of the memory to delete
schema.title: Id

parameters.description: ID of the memory to delete

schema.title: Response Delete Memory Delete Memory Delete

put.description:
Update a memory item by ID.

Args:
    request (Request): FastAPI request object
    response (Response): FastAPI response object for setting status codes
    id (str): ID of the memory to update (passed as query parameter)
    content (Optional[str]): New content for the memory
    metadata (Optional[Dict]): Updated metadata
    type (Optional[str]): Type of memory
    background_tasks (BackgroundTasks): FastAPI background tasks handler

Returns:
    Union[UpdateMemoryResponse, ErrorDetail]: Either:
        - UpdateMemoryResponse containing:
            - items: List of updated memory items
            - status: System update status (pinecone, neo4j, parse)
        - ErrorDetail containing:
            - code: HTTP status code (400, 401, etc.)
            - detail: Error message

parameters.name: id

schema.description: ID of the memory to update
schema.title: Id

parameters.description: ID of the memory to update

schema.title: Response Update Memory Update Memory Put

post.description:
Add a document (PDF/HTML/TXT) with progress tracking.

Args:
    request (Request): FastAPI request object containing the document file
    response (Response): FastAPI response object for setting status codes
    background_tasks (BackgroundTasks): FastAPI background tasks handler
    skip_background_processing (bool): Skip background processing if True
    post_objectId (Optional[str]): Optional Post objectId for updating status

Returns:
    Union[DocumentUploadResponse, ErrorDetail]: Either:
        - DocumentUploadResponse containing:
            - message: Status message
            - upload_id: Unique ID for tracking upload progress
            - status: Current status (processing/processing_degraded)
            - memory_items: List of created memory items
        - ErrorDetail containing:
            - code: HTTP status code (400, 401, etc.)
            - detail: Error message

207.description: Document upload started with degraded functionality

get.description:
Get the processing status of a document upload.

Args:
    upload_id (str): Unique identifier for the document upload
    request (Request): FastAPI request object
    response (Response): FastAPI response object for setting status codes

Returns:
    Union[DocumentUploadStatus, ErrorDetail]: Either:
        - DocumentUploadStatus containing:
            - status: Current processing status
            - progress: Processing progress (0.0 to 1.0)
            - current_page: Current page being processed
            - total_pages: Total number of pages
            - current_filename: Name of file being processed
            - error: Error message if any
        - ErrorDetail containing:
            - code: HTTP status code (401, 404, etc.)
            - detail: Error message

schema.title: Response Get Document Status Document Status  Upload Id  Get

post.description:
Upload a document (PDF/HTML/TXT) to be processed and added to memory.
    
    **Authentication Required**:
    One of the following authentication methods must be used:
    - Bearer token in `Authorization` header
    - API Key in `X-API-Key` header
    - Session token in `X-Session-Token` header
    
    **Required Headers**:
    - Content-Type: multipart/form-data
    - X-Client-Type: (e.g., 'papr_plugin', 'browser_extension')
    
    **Form Data**:
    - file: The document file to upload (PDF/HTML/TXT)
    - metadata: (optional) JSON string containing additional metadata

post.description:
Search through memories with authentication required.
    
    **Authentication Required**:
    One of the following authentication methods must be used:
    - Bearer token in `Authorization` header
    - API Key in `X-API-Key` header
    - Session token in `X-Session-Token` header
    
    **Recommended Headers**:
    ```
    Accept-Encoding: gzip
    ```
    
    The API supports response compression for improved performance. Responses larger than 1KB will be automatically compressed when this header is present.

query.title: Query
query.description: Detailed search query describing what you're looking for. For best results, write 2-3 sentences that include specific details, context, and time frame. For example: 'Find recurring customer complaints about API performance from the last month. Focus on issues where customers specifically mentioned timeout errors or slow response times in their conversations.'
examples: Show me the most critical customer pain points from my recent conversations. Focus on issues that multiple customers have mentioned and any specific feature requests or workflow improvements they've suggested.

rank_results.title: Rank Results
rank_results.description: Whether to enable additional ranking of search results. Default is false because results are already ranked when using an LLM for search (recommended approach). Only enable this if you're not using an LLM in your search pipeline and need additional result ranking.

example.query: Find recurring customer complaints about API performance from the last month. Focus on issues where customers specifically mentioned timeout errors or slow response times in their conversations.
